intro: Thyrsacanthus earlii, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red or pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are small, narrow, and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils, making it a common sight in desert landscapes.
